Job Title: Buyer

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Job Description

At Enovis™ we sweat the little things. We embrace collaboration with our partners and patients, and we glory in the grind of scientific excellence — with the goal of transforming medical technology as we know it.

Because that’s how we change the lives of patients for the better. And that’s how we create better together.

Job Title

Buyer

Reports To

Manager, Procurement

Location:

Houston

Business Unit Description

Global Supply Chain

Role Summary

Under the supervision of the Procurement Manager, the Buyer will be responsible for the sourcing and purchasing of a large variety of complex materials and services in order to effectively support the production and maintenance requirements for the plant.

In this role, you will contribute to developing appropriate stocking strategies to effectively support production. The Buyer identifies product supply sources to review and negotiate purchase price, assists the facility with new product development, and manages supplier relationships/quality/delivery/inventory levels in accordance with plant objectives.

Key Responsibilities

The following are the primary duties and responsibilities of this role. Other related duties may be assigned to meet the business need.

Purchases assigned commodities from approved and qualified suppliers in sufficient lead time to prevent material shortages and recommend cost savings when possibleEnsures that all activities are in compliance with company policies and practicesResolves problems that arise in relation to delivery dates, quality, specifications, quantity or cost of purchased goods or servicesReviews requisitions and confers with departments regarding requirements, specifications, quantity and quality of merchandise, and delivery requirementsRecommends alternate suppliers where a savings in cost or improved delivery will resultReviews and resolves discrepant invoices which are not in complete agreement with purchase ordersWorks with Accounting to resolve billing issues / returnsEstablishes standard costs for assigned commoditiesIssues purchase ordersNegotiates prices and follows competitive bidding procedures when necessary to ensure the lowest total cost for specific materials, interacting with other departments as necessaryAssist in the development of sourcing strategy, negotiations, and qualifying new suppliersAssist in internal periodic reviews of suppliers.Participate in continuous improvement activities related to Supply Chain processesCoordinate meetings between suppliers and internal team membersAssist with scheduling and materials management as needed

Minimum Basic Qualifications

3+ years’ experience in purchasing and contract negotiationsBachelor's degree or equivalent in Operations/Inventory Management or other related fields preferredISM certified (CPSM) or APICS certified (CPIM or CSCP) preferredPrior experience purchasing raw materials and finished goods.Highly experienced in working in an ERP system (NetSuite and/or Oracle preferred)Willing and able to travel inside and outside the United States

Work environment | Physical Demands

Climate controlled workspaceAbility to sit or stand for extended periods of timeMust be able to lift up to 25 pounds

Desired Characteristics

Ability to engage in contract negotiations and implement contracts in standard formCreate basic project plans, prioritize, engage resources, implement across functions & sites.Address problems quickly and effectively using factual data, possess situational flexibility, know the resources to approach for efficient resolution, and drive for resultsLearn the organization, the orthopedics business, and focus on personal growth to excel at purchasing in assigned area and expand into new areas in the futureWorking knowledge of purchasing and planning systems (ERP)Proficiency with personal computers and software including Microsoft office suite productsOrganizational, communication, interpersonal, and quick learning skills are requiredAbility to author document change notices and other internal process documentationAbility to prioritize and multi-task with little supervision

“Creating better together”. It’s the Enovis purpose, and it’s what drives us and empowers us every day on a global scale. We know that the power to create better – for our customers, our team members, and our shareholders – begins with having the best team, pursuing common goals, operating at the highest levels, and delivering extraordinary outcomes.

Watch this short on creating the next generation of better together at Enovis:

Better is... | Enovis

We Offer a Comprehensive Benefits Package Which Includes

Medical InsuranceDental InsuranceVision InsuranceSpending and Savings Accounts401(k) PlanVacation, Sick Leave, and HolidaysIncome Protection PlansDiscounted Insurance RatesLegal Services

About Enovis

Enovis Corporation (NYSE: ENOV) is an innovation-driven medical technology growth company dedicated to developing clinically differentiated solutions that generate measurably better patient outcomes and transform workflows. Powered by a culture of continuous improvement, global talent and innovation, the Company’s extensive range of products, services and integrated technologies fuels active lifestyles in orthopedics and beyond. Visit www.enovis.com to learn more.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Enovis provides equal employment opportunities based on merit, experience, and other work-related criteria and without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, sex, age, pregnancy, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. We also strive to provide reasonable accommodation to employees’ beliefs and practices that do not conflict with Enovis policies and applicable law. We value the unique contributions that every employee brings to their role with Enovis.

About Enovis™

Enovis Corporation (NYSE: ENOV) is an innovation-driven medical technology growth company dedicated to developing clinically differentiated solutions that generate measurably better patient outcomes and transform workflows. Powered by a culture of continuous improvement, global talent and innovation, the Company’s extensive range of products, services and integrated technologies fuels active lifestyles in orthopedics and beyond. For more information about Enovis, please visit www.enovis.com.

EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
